Text:
Step 1: Think about how to explain 'prehistory' to someone reading at the Middle School level.
Step 2: Select appropriate vocabulary and sentence structure.
Step 3: Write a paragraph of 50 words that follows your plan. (Note: You will need to delete your outline and any notes before submitting your final answer.)

Prehistory is the time before written history. It's like the story of the world before people could write it down. We call it prehistory because there were no books or newspapers to record what happened. Instead, scientists like archaeologists and paleontologists study fossils, bones, and artifacts to learn about this time. They even look at cave paintings and tools people used. It's like putting together a puzzle without any pictures or instructions.

Step 2: Select appropriate vocabulary and sentence structure.

Prehistory is the time before written records were kept. It started about 3 million years ago and ended around 5,000 years ago. In this time, people lived as hunters and gatherers, relying on nature for their food and shelter. They did not have cities or books, so we don't have written information about their lives. Archaeologists use tools and artifacts to learn about this period.

Text:
Step 1: Think about how to explain 'prehistory' to someone reading at the Middle School level.
Step 2: Select appropriate vocabulary and sentence structure.
Step 3: Write a paragraph of 50 words that follows your plan. Prehistory is the time before people started writing history. It's like when the dinosaurs roamed the Earth, before there were cars or computers. In prehistory, people lived as hunters and gatherers, finding food in nature and making tools from stones or bones.

Final answer: Prehistory is the time before people started writing history. It's like when the dinosaurs roamed the Earth, before there were cars or computers. In prehistory, people lived as hunters and gatherers, finding food in nature and making tools from stones or bones.
